ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A characterized_product is a type of
and a type of
for the purpose of characterizing a product. Properties that are assigned using characterized_object are outside version control, whereas properties added via product_definition are under version control.
The source type is a list of alternate choices that enables one to characterize whether a product is to be manufactured within an organization, bought, or the fact that this information is not known.
characterize a product is to be manufactured within an organization;
characterize a product is to be bought;
information, whether a product is to be manufactured within an organization or bought, is not known.

A product is a representation of a product or a type of product
The term product is defined in ISO 10303-1.
The SS Titanic is a product that could be represented by product.
Lifeboat is a class of products that could be represented by the entity data type product. Each lifeboat on the SS Titanic is a member of this class.
A product depends on one or more instances of
specifying a frame of reference that determines the validity of the information held about the product or class of products.
Products that this entity data type can represent include:
products existing in the real world;
products that may come into existence as a consequence of some realization process;
products that are functions;
products that require further detail so they may serve as the basis for other physically realizable products.
The computer used to edit this document, the Eiffel Tower, and coal are examples of products existing in the real world.
A company develops a new lawnmower, a product that will be realized through a manufacturing and assembly process.
Heating, lighting, and Internet connectivity are examples of functions.
A company may develop a generic engine that is described by a schematic drawing showing its main principles and components. This product may be used as the basis for a range of engines that share characteristics such as multi-valve and operating temperature. Then, when defining a new engine, designers create a specialization of this generic engine with specific characteristics such as cylinder volume and power.
The products or classes of products that are represented by product are specified in annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity data type.
Characterized_product shall be the only subtype of product.

ext_description.p:
the
that distinguishes the product.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example: Part numbers, stock item numbers, and serial numbers are examples of product identifiers.

ext_description.p:
the
by which the product is known.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
that characterizes the product. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

a set of
entities that defines the contexts within which the data associated with the product is relevant.

A product_category is a classification that applies to products.
In an application protocol whose context includes manufactured parts, 'mechanical part', 'electrical part', 'structural part', 'piping part', 'water pipe', and 'hot water pipe' are examples of types of product.

the
by which the product_category is known.

the
that characterizes the product_category. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
the
that distinguishes the product_category.
ext_description.note: This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to product_category as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_description.p:
Each product_category shall be the
in at most one .
ext_description.note:
The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303.
A template for constraining the population of the entity data types defined in the basic_attribute_schema is described in annex E.

ext_description.p: If a product_category participates in a graph, the value of the name attribute shall not be identical to the name attribute within any of its parent product_category entity data types.

p.ext_description:
A product_category_relationship is a hierarchical relationship of one category with another and provides a description of their relationship. If a
belongs to a , it also belongs to all of the parent categories.

ext_descriptions.note: The role of product_category_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
ext_descriptions.example:
The two sub-level s called 'cold water pipe' and 'hot water pipe' can be related to each other through the more generic
called 'piping part' by using two product_category_relationships, one product_category_relationship between 'piping part' and 'cold water pipe' and the other product_category_relationship between 'piping part' and 'hot water pipe'.
ext_descriptions.note:
Networks of instances of
may be defined using this entity.
ext_descriptions.example:
A
called 'piping part' may be the parent category of sub-categories called 'cold water pipe' and 'hot water pipe'. The
called 'hot water pipe' may be a sub-category of another
called 'boiler output pipe'. This is an example of a
network because the
called 'hot water pipe' has two parents.
ext_descriptions.note:
This entity, in conjunction with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.
ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
by which the product_category_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the product_category_relationship. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: the parent of the sub_category.
ext_description.example: In the previous example, 'piping part' would be the category for 'cold water pipe' and 'hot water pipe'.

ext_description.p: a child of the category.
ext_description.example: In the previous example 'cold water pipe' would be the sub_category for 'piping part' in one case and 'hot water pipe' would be the sub_category in the other.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A graph of
instances shall not be cyclic.

A product_definition is a representation of an aspect of a product, or of a class of products, for an identified life cycle stage. The life cycle stage for which a product_definition exists may be further characterized by discipline, by usage, or by both.
The product_definition entity type supports the representation of different views of a product for different purposes. Multiple views of the same product, or class of products, are represented by different instances of product_definition for the same .
The design of the SS Titanic and the as-built description of the SS Titanic can be represented as two instances of product_definition for the product that represents the ship itself.
The product_definition entity data type may represent particular products that are the members of an identified class of products.
Each individual lifeboat on the SS Titanic can be represented by an instance of product_definition, in which the associated
represents the class of products whose members are the lifeboats.
A product_definition can identify an occurrence of a product.
The product_definition entity data type acts as an aggregator for information about the properties of products.
The designed shape of an aeroplane can be identified by an instance of the
entity data type that is associated with the design product_definition of the aeroplane.
The usage of a product_definition in another context is specified through its participation in a
as the
in which the using context is specified by the frame_of_reference of the .
If a product_definition is considered in multiple contexts, the
shall be used to specify a collection of s.

the
that distinguishes the product_definition.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A product_definition_context_association is an association of a
with a , and specifies the meaning of this association.
A product_definition_context_association may be used to associate a using context to a . The defining context is associated to the
using .
A , initially defined in the context of 'mechanical design', and in which the representation of the shape of a product is defined, may also be relevant in the context of 'process-planning design'. For such a case, the product_definition_context_association would relate the
with the
characterizing the context 'process-planning design' and the name of the role attribute would be 'other relevant context'.

the reference to a
associated to a context.

the
that defines the stage in the product life cycle with which the
is to be associated.

the
that specifies the purpose of the association of the context of this frame_of_reference attribute with the
of the definition attribute.
ext_description.note: The meaning of this attribute can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A product_definition_context_role is a specification of the purpose of a .

the
by which the product_definition_context_role is known.

the
that characterizes the product_definition_context_role. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

A product_definition_effectivity is a type of . A product_definition_effectivity is the identification of a valid use of a particular
in the context of its participation in a given . The referenced
is the
attribute of the .
This entity data type is kept in this edition in order to ensure upward compatibility. The entity data type , introduced in this edition of this part of ISO 10303, provides extended capabilities.
Appropriate subtypes of
and further information about the way to describe assemblies are specified in ISO 10303-44.

the
that defines the context of the .
A product_definition_effectivity shall not be referred to as .

A product_definition_formation is a collector of definitions of a product.
An application interpreted model could use this entity to support the identification of different versions of a single . Each version would be described by a group of instances of the entity data type
and each group, identified by a product_definition_formation, would be associated with the same .

ext_description.p:
the
that distinguishes the product_definition_formation.
ext_description.note: The context in which id is used as a discriminating characteristic can be identified in an annotated Express schema that uses or specializes this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between partners sharing this information.
ext_description.example: Part version number is an example of a product_definition_formation identifier.

ext_description.p:
the
that characterizes the product_definition_formation. The value of the attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: This attribute may be used to depict differences in the purpose and function of different formations of a single .

ext_description.p:
the
to which the product_definition_formation belongs.
ext_description.note:
A
is associated with one or more product_definition_formation instances through the implicit inverse of this relationship.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The id of each product_definition_formation shall be unique within the collection of product_definition_formations that are related to the same product (through their attribute of_product).

A product_definition_formation_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of this relationship.
A relationship may exist between instances of the entity data type
that relate to different instances of the entity data type
or between different formations of the same .
The role of product_definition_formation_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A product_definition_formation_with_specified_source is a type of
whose source is identified to be either manufactured within an organization, bought, or the fact that this information is not known.
the characterization of the source of the .

A generic_product_definition_reference is a reference to an externally defined
that may or may not have a local representation. A generic_product_definition_reference is either a
or a .
defines the location which contains the original definition of the .

A product_definition_reference is a type of
that identifies the externally defined
by providing the key attributes necessary to unambiguously identify it and the associated ,
and organization that owns the product id.

specifies the identifier of the externally defined product, where the referenced
is assigned to one of its .
specifies the identifier of the externally defined .
specifies the identifier of the externally defined .

specifies the id owner of the externally defined product, realised by an applied
with the role 'id owner'.

A product_definition_reference_with_local_representation is a type of
that represents an externally defined
by a local .

A product_definition_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
or
and provides an identification and description of this relationship.
A relationship may exist between instances of the entity data type
that relate to different instances of the entity data type
or between different definitions of the same .
The relationships within a bill-of-materials structure are examples of product_definition_relationship entity data types that associate different s. The relationship between a sketch and a detailed design is an example of a product_definition_relationship that associates different definitions of a single .
A single
may be used more than once within the description of a .
The same component could be used more than once in the same assembly. Each usage of the component would be specified as an instance of the product_definition_relationship entity.
The role of product_definition_relationship can be defined in the annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or by default, in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

In the context of an ISO 10303 application protocol, the product_definition_relationship is an assembly component relationship, the relating_product_definition may be the assembly.

that is a part of the relationship. If one element of the relationship is dependent upon the other, this attribute shall be the dependent one.

In the context of an ISO 10303 application protocol, the related_product_definition may be the
that is an element of the assembly.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A product_definition_substitute is an association of a
with a . The association states the fact that the
may replace, in the context of the relationship, the
that is specified in the
attribute of the .
If a
exists between a component part and its assembly, a product_definition_substitute could be used to capture an allowable substitute, that is, a different component part that may be used as a replacement in the same assembly.
Two kinds of ball-point pens may be manufactured: a standard model and a deluxe model. Each model of the pen would be specified as a separate
related to a particular kind of nib: a standard nib and a deluxe nib, respectively. The fact that the deluxe nib and the standard nib are interchangeable only in the context of the standard model of ball-point pen is established with this construct.

the
that characterizes the product_definition_substitute. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p:
the
that specifies the context in which the replacement may occur.
ext_description.example:
In the previous example, the
of a
identified as a context_relationship would be the standard model of the ball-point pen and the
would be the standard nib.

ext_description.p:
the
that acts as an allowed replacement for the
of the context_relationship.
ext_description.example: In the previous example, this attribute would identify the deluxe nib .

ext_description.p:
the
by which the product_definition_substitute is known.
ext_description.note:
This attribute is an upwardly compatible addition to
as specified in ISO 10303-41:1994.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A
shall not be defined as a substitute for itself.

in at most one .

The
data type is defined in basic_attribute_schema of this part of ISO 10303

that identifies products that satisfy the type identified by the category.

A product_relationship is a relationship between two instances of the entity data type
and provides an identification and description of their relationship.

Relationships represented using this entity may be parent child relationship. Annotated EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity specify whether or not the relationship is directed.
This entity, together with the
entity, is based on the relationship template that is described in annex E.3.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The acyclic_product_category_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the category field of the relation argument.

The acyclic_product_definition_formation_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type
that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.

The acyclic_product_definition_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

(input) the set of instances of the entity data type

parameter of the relation argument.

(input) the fully qualified name of a subtype of the
entity.

The acyclic_product_relationship function determines whether the graph of instances of the entity data type
that contains relation as one of its links contains a cycle. This function may be used to evaluate either a
or any of its subtypes.
The function returns TRUE if no cycle has been detected. Otherwise it returns FALSE.
The algorithm of the function is explained in annex E.2.
This function is not used in this schema. It is defined here because other ISO 10303 integrated resources and application protocols that use the
entity include rules that use this function.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.

that the function is searching for in the
parameter of the relation argument.

entity.

The categories_of_product function returns the set of product category names associated with the argument. The function evaluates the bag of instances of
that are associated with the input
through an instance of . The function returns the SET of STRING values stored in the
attribute of the instances of
in the bag.

the
whose categories are searched.

The get_product_definitions function returns for any instance of
the set of instances of
that refer to the product through an instance of .
This function is not used in this schema.

(input) the candidate
to be checked.
